Related Resources
One Sentence Summary
🖋
80000 hours is the go to resource to find out the best career for you, how to succeed in your career and to find detailed career descriptions. Waitbutwhy also has an insightful blog post on picking a career.
Websites
80000 Hours
Evidence based, comprehensive with actionable steps and answers any questions you might have about careers. Includes profiles on high impact careers
Key Ideas: Building career capital, targeting your skills to high impact areas, aim for personal fit
Our new guide to doing good with your career
Introduction 80,000 Hours is a non-profit that provides research and support to help people switch into careers that effectively tackle the world's most pressing problems. This page is a summary of the most useful things we've learned so far.
https://80000hours.org/key-ideas/
Best Articles
Resources on career happiness, choosing your focus area, and career planning
Some further resources on high-impact careers - 80,000 Hours
Below is a list of books, essays and resources which we have found helpful in drawing up our career guide, and which we hope will help if you'd like to go into more detail. Enjoying your job and altruism Stumbling Upon Happiness, by Prof.
https://80000hours.org/articles/further-reading/
Evidence based advice on how to be successful in any job
From social skills to sleep patterns: all the self-help advice that actually works
The trouble with self-help advice is that it's often based on barely any evidence. For example, how many times have you been told to "think positively" in order to reach your goals? It's probably the most popular piece of personal guidance, beloved by everyone from high school teachers to best-selling careers experts.
https://80000hours.org/career-guide/how-to-be-successful/
List of high impact careers
Our list of high-impact careers - 80,000 Hours
80,000 Hours aims to identify particularly high-impact career paths for our readers to consider. We do this by trying to identify the most pressing global problems and the key obstacles to progress within them. Right now, this has led us to focus on career paths that reduce global catastrophic risks or otherwise improve the prospects of future generations.
https://80000hours.org/career-reviews/
50 ways to get a job
comprehensive steps involved in getting a job
50 Ways to Get a Job That Makes Good
An interactive site that gives you all the steps you need to take to find a job that makes money and does good.
https://50waystogetajob.com/
Books
So Good they Can't Ignore You
Key ideas: building career capital, debunks the follow your passion cliche
So Good They Can't Ignore You
In this eye-opening account, Cal Newport debunks the long-held belief that "follow your passion" is good advice. Not only is the cliche flawed-preexisting passions are rare and have little to do with how most people end up loving their work-but it can also be dangerous, leading to anxiety and chronic job hopping.
https://www.calnewport.com/books/so-good/
Summary
So Good They Can't Ignore You Summary - Four Minute Books
1-Sentence-Summary: So Good They Can't Ignore You sheds some much needed light on the "follow your passion" myth and shows you that the true path to work you love lies in becoming a craftsman of the work you already have, collecting rare skills and taking control of your hours in the process.
https://fourminutebooks.com/so-good-they-cant-ignore-you-summary/
Blog Post
Beyond Passion: The Science of Loving What You Do
January 23rd, 2010 · 175 comments The Great Career Laura loves what she does. To many people, myself included (I've known her for the past five years), she represents the Platonic ideal of a great career. Laura is a database whiz. Companies hire her to wrangle their most gnarly data into streamlined structures.
https://www.calnewport.com/blog/2010/01/23/beyond-passion-the-science-of-loving-what-you-do/
Videos
20 minute presentation
Cal Newport: "Follow Your Passion" Is Bad Advice
About this presentation American culture is obsessed with the idea that we need to "find our passion" in order to be happy and successful. But there's a problem: "It's astonishingly bad piece of advice," says best-selling author Cal Newport. We have no pre-existing passion.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IIMu1PGbG-0
5 minute key takeaway
How To Be So Good They Can't Ignore You | Cal Newport (Don't Find Your Passion)
My Key Takeaway From So Good They Can't Ignore You by Cal Newport ▸ [SUPPORT] (Patreon: http://bit.ly/2U6UZdV) (Alternative: http://bit.ly/2JTkBq5) ▸ [FREE] 🔥Learn Marcus Aurelius and Bill Gates' Secret | http://bit.ly/secretandfree In this eye-opening account, Cal Newport debunks the long-held belief that "follow your passion" is good advice.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qzcUd9X1cNc
Podcast
Cal Newport | So Good They Can't Ignore You (Episode 482)
Cal Newport shows us how to cultivate meaningful and successful working lives while debunking the "follow your passion" advice that lesser professors peddle to the masses. Why is "follow your passion" bad advice - and what are some better alternatives?
https://theartofcharm.com/podcast-episodes/cal-newport-so-good-they-cant-ignore-you-episode-482/
Podcast Summary
https://whatyouwilllearn.com/book/sogoodtheycantignoreyou/
Similar: Linchpin by Seth Godin
Barking up the Wrong Tree
Key Ideas: mentoring, life metrics, relationship advice
Barking Up the Wrong Tree By Eric Barker - Book Summary and Notes
"Much of what we've been told about the qualities that lead to achievement is logical, earnest-and downright wrong." - Eric Barker In "Barking Up the Wrong Tree", Eric Barker (see what he did there?) takes a look at some common misconceptions about success. Should I play it safe?
https://jamesstuber.com/barking-up-the-wrong-tree/
Blog post
How You Can Have A Fulfilling Career - 10 Scientific Steps - Barking Up The Wrong Tree
Before we commence with the festivities, I wanted to thank everyone for helping my first book become a Wall Street Journal bestseller. To check it out, click here. *** Is your job not really doing it for you? Doesn't have everything you need to feel satisfied, challenged and proud?
https://www.bakadesuyo.com/2014/08/fulfilling-career/
What 6 rules should be guiding your career? - Barking Up The Wrong Tree
Daniel Pink's The Adventures of Johnny Bunko: The Last Career Guide You'll Ever Need conveys a number of principles about the world of work that everyone should take note of. Why? Though Pink doesn't bog the story down with academic research, all of his core ideas are backed up by plenty of studies, many of which I've posted about in the past.
https://www.bakadesuyo.com/2012/09/what-6-steps-should-be-guiding-your-career/
Videos
8 minute summary
BARKING UP THE WRONG TREE by Eric Barker | Core Message
1-Page PDF Summary: https://www.productivitygame.com/upgrade-barking-up-the-wrong-tree/ Book Link: https://amzn.to/2m4aFuW FREE Audiobook Trial: http://amzn.to/2ypaVsP Animated core message from Eric Barker's book 'Barking Up the Wrong Tree.' For more animated videos and productivity articles visit http://www.productivitygame.com. Follow me on twitter @nlozeron. This video is a Lozeron Academy Inc. production.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HMZhySbJxvM
1 hour talk with the author
Eric Barker: "Barking Up the Wrong Tree" | Talks at Google
Eric Barker is the author of Barking Up the Wrong Tree. His book includes the ideas of achievement being logical, earnest...and downright wrong. Eric reveals the extraordinary science behind what actually determines success and most importantly, how anyone can achieve it. Get the book here: https://goo.gl/CC7CHP Moderated by Jordan Thibodeau.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l5mCrxjvI2A
Podcast
Interview with author of 'The One Thing'
Barking Up The Wrong Tree with Eric Barker - The ONE Thing Webinar
Join Eric Barker, bestselling author and blogger, to learn the surprising science behind why everything you know about success is mostly wrong. Eric Barker's humorous, practical blog, "Barking Up the Wrong Tree", presents science-based answers and expert insight on how to be awesome at life.
https://www.the1thing.com/webinars/eric-barker/
Blog Posts
The best advice in this post alongside 80000 hours
How to Pick a Career (That Actually Fits You) - Wait But Why
Hey readers! Quick note before we jump in: This is a post about something I've been wanting to write about forever: careers. Society tells us a lot of things about what we should want in a career and what the possibilities are-which is weird because I'm pretty sure society knows very little about any of this.
https://waitbutwhy.com/2018/04/picking-career.html
Easy advice on Choosing a Career: 2 "weird" (but effective) tips
Q: How do most people approach choosing a career? A: They don't. They stumble into a job after college, take whatever they can get, then follow one of the few paths available from that random job. No wonder most people are frustrated in their careers.
https://www.iwillteachyoutoberich.com/blog/choosing-a-career/
The Best Career Articles | Scott H Young
The 5 Best Career Articles I've written a lot about your career, but if you're looking to get started, here are my best five essays on the topic: If You Want to Be an Author Don't Start Writing (and Other Strangely Useful Career Advice) Understanding how your career actually works, not just doing what feels ...
https://www.scotthyoung.com/blog/the-best-career-articles/
Podcasts
Podcast by Adam Grant, an organizational psychologist
WorkLife with Adam Grant: A TED original podcast
You have JavaScript disabled Podcasts › As one of Apple Podcasts' most downloaded new shows of 2018, WorkLife spent two weeks as the #1 show on the entire podcast chart. Organizational psychologist Adam Grant takes you inside the minds of some of the world's most unusual professionals to explore the science of making work not suck.
https://www.ted.com/podcasts/worklife
Favorite: The Perils of Following your Career Passion
80000 hours podcast
The 80,000 Hours Podcast with Rob Wiblin - The world's most pressing problems & how to solve them.
The 80,000 Hours Podcast features unusually in-depth conversations about the world's most pressing problems and how you can use your career to solve them. We invite guests pursuing a wide range of career paths - from academics and activists to entrepreneurs and policymakers - to analyse the case for working on different issues, and provide concrete ways to help.
https://80000hours.org/podcast/
Favorite: Why we have to lie to ourselves about why we do what we do
How to Get Rich by Naval Ravikant
Timeless Advice
How to Get Rich: Every Episode
This giant episode collects all of my interviews with Nivi on How to Get Rich. These interviews are based on my tweetstorm. The individual interviews are here. The podcast is available on Apple, YouTube, Spotify, Overcast, Google, and other podcast apps. Here we go. The difference between wealth, money and status.
https://nav.al/how-to-get-rich
Videos
Jordan Person's advice on choosing a career for a meaningful life
Jordan Peterson - How to Motivate Yourself and Choose the Best Career that Will Change Your Life
Dr Jordan Peterson's ultimate advice on how to motivate yourself and choose the career so you can live meaningful life. Get his 12 Rules For Live Audio-book here: https://amzn.to/2OPaWRD FAIR-USE COPYRIGHT DISCLAIMER * Copyright Disclaimer Under Section 107 of the Copyright Act 1976, allowance is made for "fair use" for purposes such as criticism, commenting, news reporting, teaching, scholarship, and research.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m3RF8k-pSjU
Advice from Gary Vee → Great if you want a bit of motivation
57 Minutes of Advice For People Early In Their Career | Chase Fireside Chat 2019
In this fireside chat, Gary talks to a group of young professionals working for Chase bank about their professional careers and how they should be thinking about them. The amount of time in your life you actually spend working is astoundingly high so you want to make sure you like your job and are happy doing it every day.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0doo_v0EPOQ
Advice I've taken
Build Career Capital from 80000 hours → I focus on developing transferable skills like public speaking, and take on roles in University clubs to develop specific skill sets e.g. becoming a Promotions Manager to develop marketing skills
A meaningful career is one that helps others from 80000 hours → My motivation has increased since switching from aiming to be a computer engineer at a consulting company to a researcher in machine learning safety.
Don't focus on following your passion from Cal Newport → Anytime I overthink what I am passionate about I get overwhelmed and question everything I do. Trusting my intuition and developing my skills has become
Related Resources
Advice on becoming a generalist, and advice on becoming a specialist, and a discussion between those who propose each
Lean In by Sheryl Sandberg has mindset shifting career advice for women
